Content:
if you're looking for what symptoms the player has, it's not going to be in modifiers. you'd want to check against the `SymptomsManager`, symptoms are queued into a pool, and only last for their set duration. depending on what you're trying to accomplish you can check the array of symptoms that are queued or you can setup a `ScriptInvoker` to externally send out information when `SpawnSymptom` or `OnSymptomExit` are called, or just go the lazy route and have your logic call from inside these methods.

`class SymptomsManager`
can be acquired from `PlayerBase`, 
primary queue array `player.GetSymptomManager().m_SymptomQueuePrimary`
secondary queue array `player.GetSymptomManager().m_SymptomQueueSecondary`

Author: wrdg
Content: there's also the `GetCurrentPrimaryActiveSymptom` method, but can be a hit and a miss if you miss when it's active, as symptoms only last for their set duration

Author: wrdg
Content: `SymptomsManager` is also more likely server side handled, so you'd want to take that into account when doing what ever you're doing
